sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Israel says it killed a second senior Hamas commander in the Gaza Strip. Meanwhile, the opening of the Rafah border crossing has allowed at least 76 injured Palestinians to travel to Egypt for treatment.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Hundreds of people with foreign passports are fleeing the besieged territory through the same crossing.

sentences.sentence: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has warned of a long and difficult fight. Ukraine says it feels optimistic about the opening of EU accession

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: talks this year. Speaking at a ministerial conference in Berlin on Thursday, Foreign Minister Dmitry Kuleba highlighted the efforts Kyiv has made to fulfill its obligations, even in the face of the Russian invasion.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Dmitry Kuleba, Foreign Minister of the United States of America, Our main position that I brought from Kyiv is that EU reform should not take enlargement process as a hostage and we have to find the right balance between the process of reforming the European Union and continuing with enlargement.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The European Union is in the midst of a broad renewal process and there is an ongoing debate on whether the bloc should complete its reforms before accepting new members or whether to expand first and then work on change together.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Representatives will meet mid-December in Brussels to discuss enlargement as well as membership bids from Ukraine and Moldova.

sentences.sentence: After passing in the lower house state Duma a week ago, on Thursday Russian President

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Vladimir Putin signed off on a bill that shifts Moscow's legal stance on nuclear testing.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Putin says the move to abandon the landmark agreement outlawing nuclear weapons tests brings Moscow into line with Washington.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The 1996 treaty outlaws all nuclear explosions, including live tests of nuclear weapons, but was never effective because several key countries failed to ratify it.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Democracy is in decline throughout the world.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: That's the assessment of the International Institute for Democracy and Electoral Assistance, otherwise known as IDEA, which shows a global surge in authoritarian tendencies.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The report, released Thursday called The Global State of Democracy 2023, says that every region in the world has seen a democratic decline.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: This is the sixth consecutive year of declines in our data set, the longest such period we've seen since we started collecting data. The study, based on 173 countries, uses 17 different metrics to determine rankings, including civil liberties, judicial independence and the rule of law.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Europe comes out on top as the world's highest performing region, but the situation varies throughout the continent.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: It's important to remember that Europe remains the highest performing region in the world.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: It continues to lead.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: It dominates the top of the rankings, which we have released this year.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Of course, in certain countries, including high performing countries, there have been really important declines.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: These countries remain high performing, but it's important to stem those declines now before they become more serious.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: So we've seen things like restrictions on freedom of expression, freedom of the press, and rule of law across Europe and in those countries specifically.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The usual suspects, Hungary and Poland, are the European Union's lowest-ranking member states, but Romania makes its way in there too as the third worst.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Unsurprisingly, Nordic countries are the bloc's best democratic performers.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Denmark is top both in Europe and across the world, with Finland and Sweden coming in third and fourth, as Germany squeezes into second place.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Austria and Portugal are two of the countries that get special mentions due to their steep declines when it comes to the rule of law.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: But it's not all bad news for Europe.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: We have identified Central Europe, some countries in Central Europe, as sort of the new epicenter of democratic growth in the region.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: We have seen really significant growth in countries like Moldova, Armenia, Slovenia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: And the advances have been quite dramatic in some cases.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The report also points to recent elections in Poland, for example, which could see the possible new government row back various measures that contributed to the country's democratic decline. But overall, it says that democracies should not be taken for granted and need constant attention if they're to remain strong.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: have been illegally deporting migrants from two Greek islands to Turkey.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: That's according to the charity Doctors Without Borders, or MSF.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: In a new report published on Thursday, the NGO documented allegations of boats stopped at sea and towed back to Turkish waters. The organization interviewed 56 people who claimed to have experienced these so-called pushbacks, nine of whom said they had fallen victim to the practice between eight and 14 times. The report also claimed that some people who had reached Lesbos and Samos were rounded up before they could claim asylum, mistreated, and then dumped offshore on inflatable life rafts. Some MSF staff reported seeing people screaming and crying after being beaten.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06

sentences.sentence: For the first time since its discovery in 1975, a secret room with drawings by Michelangelo has opened to the public. The tiny space, which is accessible via the new sacristy in the museum of the Medici chapels in Florence, contains numerous charcoal drawings.
